metadata.title: CVE-2024-44187 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A cross-origin issue existed with "iframe" elements. This was addressedwith improved tracking of security origins. This issue is fixed in Safari18, visionOS 2, watchOS 11, macOS Sequoia 15, iOS 18 and iPadOS 18, tvOS18. A malicious website may exfiltrate data cross-origin.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-44187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.46.1-0ubuntu0.22.04.3').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
